item.content:
During quarantine, some friends and me decided to tackle a exciting project. It was centered around training a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) to recognize certain fashion articles in Instagram pictures. The final goal was to find relevant posts from influencers and create a keyword which potentially generates more traffic the next days and can be used for GoogleAdWords Marketing.

We started with the Google Open Image Database and trained a Yolo-V3 CNN in Google Colab to recognize different fashion articles (e.g. dresses, shoes, …) on several thousands of pictures. Afterwards, we’d scrape some influencer pictures from Instagram and would classify them whether they contain fashion articles. After cropping and detecting the main color of the item, we decided to give out a keyword in the form of “(Influencer name) (main color) (fashion articel)” (e.g. “Adele Blue Dress”). Afterwards, we’d map this result to GoogleTrends via an Python-API and check for any significant peaks in the search interest. Lastely, we also played around with setting up a small front-end for the CNN using steamlit.

TO conclude, for me this project was a fascinating chance for learning. One had to dig into differnt solutions for the different challenges which arouse during the development and I was able to strenghten my skills in web-scraping, utilizing state-of-the-art ML models, APIs and front-end development.

item.content:
Background

This project is concerned with the work of my Bachelor’s thesis. During the four months, I investigated the phase transition of the Ising model with machine learning and applied the same methodology to another statistcal model. Hereby, apart from a pratical course during the studies, I had never worked with machine learning before, so this was a great opportunity to dig deeper into the topic. Also, the thesis formed my first real contact with the Python programming language.

Project description

First, we began by reproducing the previous work of other researchers (Wetzel, 2017; Metha et. al., 2018) and learned the order parameter of the 2D Ising model. Hereby, we relied on two different approaches: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and Variational Autoencoders (VAEs). In the next step, we applied exactly the same methodology to another physical model, the so-called rod-model (Oettel et. al., 2016). For both models, the configurations needed as training data was generated by Markov-Chain-Monte-Carlo (MCMC) sampling.

Results

We were able to show, the even for the new model, the machine learning methods are able to extract the order parameter by themselves (see plot above).

Learnings

For me, the thesis provided an excellent opportunity to explore the domain of machine learning. For me, the most important learnings were:

  • Programming
    • Python & corresponding packages
      • Numpy, Matplotlib, Keras, Scikit-Learn
    • Anaconda
    • Linux Shell interaction
  • Methodological
    • Unsupervised machine learning
    • Principal Component Analysis (PCA)
    • Variational Autoencoders (VAEs)
    • Markov-Chain-Monte-Carlo (MCMC) sampling
